title: Introducing: Noble Oak
content:
There’s some stunning electro-ambient music coming out of Canada at the moment, and Vancouver’s Noble Oak is not about to deviate from this trend. The solo project of ‘Patty’, his new EP entitled No Bloke is a dreamy journey through hazy vocals and reverb heavy synths, proving both relaxing and beauteous at the same time. Opener Triple Back Flip is hugely Washed Out influenced with, dare I say it, chillwave roots shining through. Aside from softly murmured harmonies, all Noble Oak’s work is instrumental, however it’s still brilliantly endearing and desirably personal. As a debut release, it’s fantastically confident, and nigh on perfect production wise, even if it is grounded in simplicity. Check out a couple of my choice picks from No Bloke below, and head over to Noble Oak’s bandcamp to pick up the EP.

Twenty Past Four by Noble Oak

Perfect Triple Backflip by Noble Oak
